Node.definition: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= man; ◄ Naamathite (נַעֲמָתִי) ► friend of Job (אִיֹּוב) who comes to comfort but concludes by arguing with Job
= inhabitant of Naamah (נַעֲמָה)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical

Node.gloss: to prove to be righteous|to be just|to be in the right|to be innocent
Node.definition: = state or process by which humans and deities are found to conform to an accepted code of behavior
= action by which someone utters words that are considered arrogant and foolish, for which one ought to be ashamed
= human beings, regardless of sex and age
= action by which someone purposely refrains from responding, either with words or with actions
only used in poetry; = action by which humans or deities express their disdain of others with words, sounds and/or gestures

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= causative action by which humans cause other humans to experience a feeling of shame

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: pure; hence: = state in which an event is considered without fault

= causative action by which humans and deities give verbal instruction to other humans, and by which the focus is on the communication of the message rather than the content of the message; ≈ often connoting persuasive or eloquent speech
= state in which an event happens entirely as desired or required, without any interference that could be considered a flaw

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= marker indicating that the information that follows is in contrast with what has preceded

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= action by which humans or animals open their mouth ► in order to speak
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
literally: double; hence: = state in which an event or state is double or more than double in intensity than what is expected
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= action when one is no longer able to remember or recall a person or a past experience
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= action by which someone makes an effort to obtain information about events
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
literally: to find (in someone); hence: = process by which humans come upon certain information

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical
particle marking a phrase indicating a certain quantity; = marker emphasizing that the quantity expressed will not be exceeded
= deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God
literally: to find (in someone); hence: = process by which humans come upon certain information
= state in which something is located high up in the air and out of human reach; ≈ sometimes used as a metaphor to describe things that are beyond human understanding

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen

= abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= pertaining to being relatively lengthy in size

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= the overall dimensions or capacity of an object
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= action by which deities or humans move from one location to another

Node.gloss: to shut in|to shut up|to imprison
Node.definition: = action of restricting or containing a person or an object to a specific space

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
literally: to cause (someone else) to turn (from an activity); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or deities to stop being engaged in a certain activity
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= human beings, regardless of sex and age
= state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= great wickedness and depravity, as a trait of certain human beings, which is expressed in thoughts, words, and actions; ≈ regarded as unacceptable and worthy of punishment by God

Node.gloss: to look closely|to take note|to pay attention|to consider|to understand|to draw understanding
Node.definition: = action by which someone observes something carefully, with the intention of seeing through the outward appearance of things and grasping their essence, and so gain knowledge and understanding
literally: to get heart; hence: = process by which humans learn to think for themselves as opposed to being easily swayed by what others say or do
= young male donkey (חֲמֹור) ≈ possibly associated with liveliness and unruliness

= wild donkey of a relatively large size but with relatively small ears; it has a fawn color with a whitish chest and belly; ◄ Persian Wild Ass or Onager, Equus hemonius; ≈ associated with both untameable wildness and sexual desire
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse

Node.gloss: to be committed (to someone or something)
Node.definition: literally: to direct (one's) heart
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= action by which humans or animals spread out part of their body

Node.gloss: to spread out one's hands > to pray
Node.definition: literally: to spread out or lift up one's palms; hence: = to present one's prayer and supplication before God by showing him one's empty hands
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= great wickedness and depravity, as a trait of certain human beings, which is expressed in thoughts, words, and actions; ≈ regarded as unacceptable and worthy of punishment by God
literally: (someone's) hand; = state in which humans bear the responsibility for a certain situation
= location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside
= the state of being or acting in an unjust or morally evil way
= referent pointing to a specific condition or circumstance
literally: to lift up (one's) face or head); hence: = action by which humans look up without shame
literally: blemish, defect; hence: = state in which humans are guilty of misbehavior, which is a stain on their reputation
= state in which humans and animals are not easily frightened, an attitude which is said to reside in the heart (לֵב)

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind
= the time of the day when the sun is at its highest point
= the timespan that a human being is on this world
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

Node.gloss: to be confident|to be unsuspecting|to be secure
Node.definition: = state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH

= state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time
= process by which humans experience a strong emotion of shame
= state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH

= state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security
= action by which humans or animals assume a horizontal position, either to rest or to attack

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= causative action by which humans inspire a strong fear in (other) humans or animals, ► resulting in panic
literally: to weaken someone's face; hence: = causative action by which humans make an effort to make (other) humans or deities willing to act in their favor
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
literally: (one's) eyes are finished; hence: = process by which someone's eyes become affected by excessive weeping or hardship

Node.gloss: to vanish|to disappear|to be lost|to perish|to be broken|to be destroyed|to be ruined
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects disappear or are removed from existence;◄ either by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, natural processes, acts of destruction, or direct divine intervention

= state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time
literally breathing of soul; hence: = process by which humans breathe for the last time before dying
literally: throat, but with focus on the air flowing through it; hence: = process by which air flows in and out of the body, which shows that a person or animal is alive
